response.answer_text: VicePresidents really don’t have much to do except vote in the Senate in case of a tie, which never happens; it is not possible to assess their performance. There was one VicePresident, Agnew, under Nixon, who was charged with accepting bribes when he was a state governor and was forced to resign. He might be the worse; the situation was prickly since Nixon himself was being forced out at the time. After Agnew’s departure Gerald Ford became VicePresident and when Nixon resigned Ford became President and immediately granted pardons to Nixon and Agnew, with the result that when Ford ran for the presidency on his own he was not elected.

I would think Nelson Rockefeller. He was the VP to President Gerald Ford. There actually is a precedent to what is going on today. Mr. Rockefeller’s brother was working on bringing the Chase Bank to Russia during the Ford Administration. It was a time when during the 1976 Presidential Debate, President Ford was convinced Eastern Europe was a free society and that there wasn’t any real intervention in Eastern Europe from Russia. I came across as if the president was brain washed by the VP and business interests in Russia. President Gerald Ford later lost the election to former peanut farmer Jimmy Carter and, according to some reports, was placed on suicide watch.

Aaron Burr fought a duel and killed a man while Vice President.Andrew Johnson showed up drunk to his inauguration and proceeded to make a drunken speech during which he forgot the name of the secretary of the Navy. He made other drunken appearances later as president as well.Spiro Agnew committed crimes and was forced to resign.Dick Cheney directed his aides to commit crimes — Scooter Libby — on his behalf and was rather upset with President Bush for not pardoning them later.

Dick Cheney has to take the prize; he pushed hard for a phony war that would enrich his oil industry buddies. A little Nazi. Halliburton got richer; many thousands died. But don’t forget another Texan, LBJ, who got a promotion by killing his boss, JFK.
Henry Wallace was actually a communist asset with ties to the KGB...so he is.
If I had to guess, probably Hannibal Hamlin, Abraham Lincoln’s first VP, who got paid yet never bothered to show up for work.
I think I’d put Spiro Agnew at the top of a list of worst VP’s.
